title: Voice Control Basics
description: Learn how to talk naturally to AI and get started with voice-first workflows

sections.heading: Why Voice Changes Everything
content: Typing is slow. Your brain thinks faster than your fingers can move. When you talk to AI, you unlock a more natural way to work. You can explain complex ideas while walking, driving, or doing other tasks. Voice lets you multitask in ways typing never could.

Research backs this up: A Stanford University study found that speech is **3x faster** than typing on mobile devices (150 words per minute vs 40 WPM), with a **20% lower error rate**. You can dictate a 500-word email in 3 minutes. Typing that same email might take 12-15 minutes.

examples.title: ✅ DO: Talk naturally, like you're explaining to a colleague
examples.example: Hey, I need to write an email to my team about next week's meeting. Make it friendly but professional. Include the agenda items we discussed yesterday.

examples.title: ❌ DON'T: Talk like a robot or use formal commands
examples.example: Computer. Compose electronic mail. Subject: Meeting. Body: Formal greeting...

sections.heading: Built-In Voice Features
sections.intro: Most AI tools now have voice built right in. You don't need special software to get started:

tools.name: ChatGPT Advanced Voice
tools.description: Natural conversation mode with real-time interruption handling. Works on mobile, desktop, and web. Choose from multiple voice personalities.

tools.name: Claude Voice
tools.description: Voice input in mobile app powered by Claude Sonnet 4. Five voice options. English only. Great for on-the-go conversations and quick questions.
tools.pricing: Free: 20-30 messages | Paid: Significantly higher limits

tools.name: Perplexity Assistant
tools.description: Voice search with real-time web results and source links. Mobile apps only (not available on web). Pro subscription required for unlimited voice.
tools.pricing: Free: 5 voice messages trial | Pro Plan required for full features

tools.name: Google Gemini Voice (Gemini Live)
tools.description: Natural conversation with 10 voice options. Hands-free background mode. Integrated with Google services. Android primarily, rolling out to iOS.
tools.pricing: Free for Android | Gemini Advanced subscription for full features

callout.title: Try This Right Now (5 minutes):
steps: Open your AI assistant on your phone (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, or Perplexity)
Tap the headphone or microphone icon to start voice mode
Say: 'I need to write a quick update email to my team about our project status. Keep it brief and positive.'
Listen to the AI's response, then say: 'Make it more casual' or 'Add a bullet list'
Copy the result and send it!
callout.footer: That's it. You just created something in 2 minutes that would have taken 10-15 minutes to type.

sections.heading: The Science Behind Voice Efficiency
content: Peer-reviewed research confirms that voice input dramatically outperforms typing:

**Speed:** Average speaking speed is 150-180 words per minute ([National Center for Voice and Speech](https://virtualspeech.com/blog/average-speaking-rate-words-per-minute)), while average typing speed is only 38-40 WPM. Professional typists reach 65-75 WPM—still slower than casual speech. [Stanford research](https://arxiv.org/abs/1608.07323) found voice input is 3× faster than mobile typing (Ruan et al., 2016).

**Multitasking:** Voice interfaces enable hands-free operation, allowing you to work while your hands and eyes are occupied with other activities. [Healthcare studies](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2815406/) show hands-free communication tools reduce communication time by 25% (Vandenkerkhof et al., 2009) and [51% of physicians report time savings](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC10035815/) with voice recognition technology.

**Cognitive Load:** Voice typing reduces mental overhead by enabling natural thought expression. [Research shows](https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/2207676.2208386) voice input results in 29% fewer user corrections and lower cognitive demand compared to traditional dictation (Kumar et al., CHI 2012). Speaking is less cognitively demanding than typing, as writing requires sustained attention, planning, and motor execution.

**Accuracy:** Modern speech recognition (2016 onwards) achieves [20% lower error rates](https://arxiv.org/abs/1608.07323) than mobile typing for English, and up to 63% lower for Mandarin (Stanford, Ruan et al.). These improvements stem from advances in deep learning and neural networks.

**Additional Research:** [Federal Reserve study (2024)](https://www.stlouisfed.org/on-the-economy/2025/feb/impact-generative-ai-work-productivity) found workers using generative AI save an average of 2.2 hours per week. [Harvard/BCG study (2023)](https://www.hbs.edu/faculty/Pages/item.aspx?num=64700) showed consultants using AI completed tasks 25% faster with 40% higher quality.
